about-comic.defaultMessage: Three panel comic titled "MicroPython Rocks" by Mike Rowbit. A cartoon snake introduces Damien, saying "Meet Damien... He created MicroPython.". Two snakes discuss MicroPython. The yellow snake says "MicroPython is designed to work on very small computers." "Like your BBC micro:bit" the purple snake replies." The yellows snake continues "But Python can run anywhere.". The purple snake agrees, saying "Like on this rack of servers that run huge websites". The background behind the snakes shows a server rack.
about-comic.description: Alt text for comic in the about dialog

about-microbit.defaultMessage: Made with love by the <link>Micro:bit Educational Foundation and contributors</link>

about-micropython.defaultMessage: The editor depends on <link>MicroPython</link> which is made by Damien George and a community of developers around the world.

about-read-less-micropython.description: Aria label to collapse an expanded section about MicroPython

about-read-more-micropython.description: Aria label to expand a collapsed section about MicroPython

accessibility.description: Menu item for link to accessibility site

api-description.description: Extended description at the top of the API tab

apidocs-baseclass.description: Prefix for a single base class or a list of base classes. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format.

apidocs-classes.description: Heading in API documentation for the classes in a Python module

apidocs-fields.description: Heading in API documentation for the fields in a Python module

apidocs-functions.description: Heading in API documentation for the functions in a Python module

apidocs-methods.description: Heading in API documentation for the methods in a Python class

back-to-main.description: Text button, takes back to main code

change-files.description: Header for dialog of confirmation of files changed

choose-main-add-file.description: Shown in load dialog to confirm actions

clear.description: Aria label for the search input

code-editor.description: Aria label for the code editor

code-example.description: Visually hidden text to announce code examples in the toolkit documentation

confirm-delete.description: Confirmation header of deletion of a file

confirm-replace-body.defaultMessage: Replace all files with those in the hex?

confirm-replace-title.description: Confirmation message title for replacing project dialog

confirm-replace-with-idea.description: Confirmation message body for replacing project dialog with an idea

confirm-save-hint.defaultMessage: Cancel then use Save to keep a copy of your project.
confirm-save-hint.description: Hint shown when the user has unsaved changes that they might lose if they continue with an action

connect-cable-title.description: Title for the connect cable dialog

connect-help-alt.defaultMessage: WebUSB connection dialog with BBC micro:bit entry labelled 1 and Connect button labelled 2
connect-help-alt.description: Alt text for image in connect help dialog

connect-help-message.description: Text in the connect help dialog

connect-help-one.description: Legend text for the connect help dialog image

connect-help-title.description: Title for the connect help dialog

connect-help-two.description: Legend text for the connect help dialog image

connect-hover.defaultMessage: Connect to your micro:bit over WebUSB

connect-microbit.defaultMessage: Connect to your micro:bit to see serial output here

connect-troubleshoot.defaultMessage: Troubleshoot problems with connecting to your micro:bit
connect-troubleshoot.description: Text in no the micro:bit found and firmware update dialogs

content-load-error.defaultMessage: Something went wrong. Download your hex file for safe keeping, then refresh the page to reload.
content-load-error.description: Text displayed when content fails to load

cookies-action.description: Action to show dialog to choose website cookie preferences

copied.description: Text shown after copy to clipboard

copy-code-action.description: Copy code to clipboard action text

copy-snippet-advice.defaultMessage: Code copied, use paste to insert it.
copy-snippet-advice.description: Toast shown when you copy from API or Reference snippets

create-action.description: Create action label (e.g. in create file dialog)

create-file-action.description: Button text for action that creates a new blank Python file in the current project

create-python.defaultMessage: Create a new Python file in this project
create-python.description: Hover and dialog title when creating a new Python file

created-file.description: Action feedback for creating a file

deleted-file.description: Confirmation message that file got deleted

dont-show-again.description: Text to never show a dialog again

edit-name-project-hover.defaultMessage: Edit the name of your project

edit-project-name-action.description: Text for user to edit the name of the project

failed-to-build-hex.defaultMessage: Failed to build the hex file
failed-to-build-hex.description: Error title when we cannot build the hex file, for example because no storage space. Additional detail is shown separately.

file-actions.description: Header of file actions for file

file-name-invalid-character.defaultMessage: The name contains an invalid character: {invalid}
file-name-invalid-character.description: Warning text for new Python file name with an invalid character

file-name-length.description: Warning text for overly long file names (file system limitation)

file-name-lowercase-only.defaultMessage: The name should be all lowercase
file-name-lowercase-only.description: Warning text for new Python file with uppercase

file-name-not-empty.description: Warning text for new Python file with empty name

file-name-start-number.defaultMessage: The name cannot start with a number
file-name-start-number.description: Warning text for new Python file names starting with a number

file-name-whitespace.description: Warning text for new Python file name with whitespace

firmware-update-link.defaultMessage: You must <link>update your firmware</link> before you can connect to this micro:bit.
firmware-update-link.description: Text in the firmware update dialog

firmware-update-message.defaultMessage: Connecting to the micro:bit failed because the firmware on your micro:bit is too old.
firmware-update-message.description: Text in the firmware update dialog

firmware-update-title.description: Title for the firmware update dialog

flash-hover.defaultMessage: Flash the project directly to the micro:bit

flashing-code.description: Progress dialog text for partial flashes (quick)

flashing-full-flash-detail.defaultMessage: Your code is being sent (flashed) to your micro:bit. This can take a while the first time but it will be quicker after that.
flashing-full-flash-detail.description: Message shown after the title in the progress dialog for a full flash

flashing-micropython.description: Progress dialog text for full flashes (slower)

guide-link.defaultMessage: For more support, see the <link>Python Editor guide</link>
guide-link.description: Text with an external link to support/help content

help-support.description: Menu item for link to support site

ideas-tab.description: Ideas tab button text. Tab shows programs to give students ideas.

ideas-tab-description.defaultMessage: Try out these projects, modify them and get inspired
ideas-tab-description.description: Ideas tab description text. Tab shows programs to give students ideas.

load-error-makecode-info.defaultMessage: This hex file cannot be loaded in the Python Editor. The Python Editor cannot open hex files created with Microsoft MakeCode.

load-error-makecode-link.defaultMessage: Please visit <link>https://makecode.microbit.org/</link> to use this hex file.

load-error-mixed.defaultMessage: A hex file can only be loaded on its own. It replaces all files in the project.

load-error-mpy.defaultMessage: This version of the Python Editor doesn't currently support adding .mpy files.

load-error-title.description: Title of error dialog when we cannot load files. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format.

microbit-hearts-alt.defaultMessage: micro:bit board with the 5 by 5 LED grid showing a heart
microbit-hearts-alt.description: Alt text for micro:bit image in About dialog

micropython-history.defaultMessage: Learn how MicroPython on the micro:bit came to be
micropython-history.description: Links to MicroPython history in the about dialog

micropython-source-code.defaultMessage: MicroPython <linkV1>source code for the micro:bit V1</linkV1> and <linkV2>micro:bit V2</linkV2>
micropython-source-code.description: Links to the MicroPython source code in the about dialog

more-connect-options.description: Aria label for the additional actions menu to the right of the Send to micro:bit button

more-ideas.description: Link to more ideas on the microbit.org website at the end of the ideas section

more-save-options.description: Aria label for the additional actions menu to the right of the Save button

multiple-files-message-one.defaultMessage: This project contains {fileCount, plural, other {{fileCount} files}} but only main.py has been downloaded.
multiple-files-message-one.description: Message in dialog shown when multiple files are available for download. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format. In practice, fileCount will always be two or more.

multiple-files-message-two.defaultMessage: Use the Save button to download your whole project as a hex file. You can Open the hex file to restore your project. If you prefer to download individual Python files, use the Project tab.
multiple-files-message-two.description: Message in dialog shown when multiple files are available for download

multiple-files-title.description: Title of dialog shown when multiple files are available for download but only the main file downloaded.

name-used-when.defaultMessage: The name is used when you save a file.

new-file-hint.defaultMessage: We'll add the .py extension for you.
new-file-hint.description: Hint shown in the new Python file dialog

not-found-checklist-one.defaultMessage: Is your micro:bit plugged in? Did you follow these steps?
not-found-checklist-one.description: Checklist text in the no micro:bit found dialog

not-found-checklist-two.defaultMessage: If you have a micro:bit V1 you may need to update the firmware
not-found-checklist-two.description: Checklist text in the no micro:bit found dialog

not-found-message.defaultMessage: You didn’t select a micro:bit, or there was a problem connecting to it.
not-found-message.description: Text in the no micro:bit found dialog

not-found-save-message.defaultMessage: Alternative method: choose Save then follow steps to transfer
not-found-save-message.description: Save prompt in the no micro:bit found dialog

not-found-title.description: Title for the micro:bit found dialog

not-found-update-link.defaultMessage: You must <link>update your firmware before</link> you can connect to this micro:bit.
not-found-update-link.description: Text in the no micro:bit found dialog

offline-image-alt.description: Alt text for an image placeholder when the user is offline

open-file-dropped.description: Aria label for file drop target

open-hover.defaultMessage: Open a hex or Python file or add other files

parameter-help.description: Setting label to control whether pop-up documentation for function/method parameters is automatically shown.

parameter-help-automatic.description: Parameter help setting for when the parameter documentation is shown automatically

parameter-help-manual.description: Parameter help setting for when the user must press a key combination to open the parameter documentation

permanently-delete.description: Confirmation question to permanently delete file

post-save-message-files.defaultMessage: This contains all files in this project (including any additional files, e.g. to run accessories, listed in the Project tab).
post-save-message-files.description: Message in dialog shown after the user saves the project as a hex file.

post-save-message-one.defaultMessage: You will find your hex file in this computer’s Downloads folder.
post-save-message-one.description: Message in dialog shown after the user saves the project as a hex file.

post-save-message-two.defaultMessage: You can move it to another folder for storage and use Open to continue editing later.
post-save-message-two.description: Message in dialog shown after the user saves the project as a hex file.

post-save-title.description: Title of dialog shown after the user saves the project as a hex file.

post-save-transfer-hex.defaultMessage: To run this hex file on your micro:bit <link>follow these steps</link>.
post-save-transfer-hex.description: Message in dialog shown after the user saves the project as a hex file.

project-actions.description: Aria label for the bar with project actions

project-header.description: Aria label for the project header area

project-name.description: Text used to indicate the project name

project-name-not-empty.defaultMessage: The project name cannot be empty

project-tab-description.defaultMessage: View, create, add and edit the files in your project

quit-anyway.defaultMessage: Some of your changes have not been saved. Quit anyway?

read-less.description: Action text to collapse an expanded section

read-more.description: Action text to expand a collapsed section

redo.description: Aria label for the redo button

replace-action-label.description: Action label for replacing project dialog

reset-project-action.description: Action to reset the project to its default state

reset-project-feedback.defaultMessage: Project reset to the default starter code
reset-project-feedback.description: Confirmation message after resetting the project

reset-project-hover.defaultMessage: Resets the project to the default starter code, discarding your work

results-count.defaultMessage: {count, plural, =0 {No results} one {# result} other {# results}}
results-count.description: Number of results from a search. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format.

save-file-action.description: Menu option to save a file

save-hex-action.description: Text for menu item for saving a project hex file

save-hover.defaultMessage: Save the project hex file to your computer

save-python-action.description: Save button menu option to save the Python script

send-hover.defaultMessage: Connect via WebUSB then flash code onto micro:bit

serial-collapse.description: Action label to collapse the serial console/REPL area

serial-ctrl-c-action.description: Button to trigger the Python REPL from the serial area

serial-ctrl-d-action.description: Button to reset the micro:bit from the serial area

serial-expand.description: Action label to expand the serial console/REPL area

serial-flashed.description: Shown when your program is in sync with the micro:bit

serial-help-ctrl-c.defaultMessage: Use the keyboard shortcut <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>C</kbd> to interrupt your program. Then you can type Python commands for MicroPython to run. It's a great way to experiment with something new.
serial-help-ctrl-c.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog. kbd tag shows a keyboard key style.

serial-help-ctrl-d.defaultMessage: To start your program running again use <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>D</kbd>.
serial-help-ctrl-d.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog.  kbd tag shows a keyboard key style.

serial-help-intro.defaultMessage: The serial terminal shows errors and other output from the program running on your micro:bit. By default, it shows the most recent error from the program. Expand it to see all the output.
serial-help-intro.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-help-print.defaultMessage: Your program can print messages using the print function. Try adding print('micro:bit is awesome') to your program.
serial-help-print.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog. code tag shows monospaced font.

serial-help-title.description: Title for the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-hints-and-tips.description: Link/button to open the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-menu.description: Aria label for serial area menu

serial-ready-to-flash.description: Shown when your program is out of sync with the micro:bit

serial-running.description: Indicator text when the micro:bit is running a program

serial-terminal.description: Aria label for the serial terminal

setting-allow-editing-third-party-info.defaultMessage: Changing third-party modules may mean they don’t work as intended.

setting-warn-on-v2-only-features-info.defaultMessage: Warnings are shown in the editor when a micro:bit V1 is connected

show-api-documentation.description: Shown on link from editor autocomplete and signature help to the API docs.

show-less.description: Show less for general progressive disclosure

show-less-for.description: Show less with item usually for aria label

show-more.description: Show more for general progressive disclosure

show-more-for.description: Show more with item usually for aria label

sidebar.description: Aria label for the area on the left

sidebar-collapse.description: Aria label for the collapse sidebar button

sidebar-expand.description: Aria label for the expand sidebar button

simulator-actions.description: Aria label for the bar with simulator actions (stop, mute etc)

simulator-button-a.description: Button A aria label on the simulator board

simulator-button-b.description: Button B aria label on the simulator board

simulator-button-hold-label.description: Aria label for simulator toggle button

simulator-button-press-label.description: Aria label for simulator push button

simulator-collapse.description: Aria label for the collapse simulator button

simulator-collapse-module.description: Aria label for collapse simulator module button

simulator-compass-heading-one.description: Sub heading for simulator Compass panel

simulator-compass-heading-two.description: Sub heading for simulator Compass panel

simulator-data-logging-empty.description: Shown in the simulator Data logging table when there are no rows

simulator-data-logging-full.description: Shown below the simulator Data logging table to warn that the log is full

simulator-data-logging-rows.defaultMessage: {count, plural, =0 {No rows logged} one {# row logged} other {# rows logged}}
simulator-data-logging-rows.description: Indicator of the number of rows logged in the simulator Data logging table. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format.

simulator-data-logging-save-log.description: Action label to save the data log as a file from the Data logging simulator panel

simulator-data-logging-truncated.description: Text shown in the simulator Data logging table to indicate that old rows have been omitted

simulator-expand.description: Aria label for the expand simulator button

simulator-expand-module.description: Aria label for expand simulator module button

simulator-gesture-select.description: Aria label for the simulator gesture select input

simulator-gesture-send.description: Aria label for the simulator gesture send button

simulator-input-hold.description: Label for UI toggles to hold simulator buttons or pins

simulator-input-press.description: Label for UI buttons to press simulator buttons or pins

simulator-loud.description: Simulator sound level high threshold marker hover text. This should match the translation of microbit.SoundEvent.LOUD in the api.en.json file but with differing case.

simulator-mute.description: Aria label for the mute simulator button

simulator-pin-hold-label.description: Aria label for simulator pin control

simulator-pin-press-label.description: Aria label for simulator pin control

simulator-quiet.description: Simulator sound level low threshold marker hover text. This should match the translation of microbit.SoundEvent.QUIET in the api.en.json file but with differing case.

simulator-radio-code.description: Visually hidden text for a radio message sent from the simulated micro:bit. Text of the message follows.

simulator-radio-group-notice.description: Message in radio simulator area when the radio group changes

simulator-radio-message.description: Label and placeholder for the simulator radio message input field

simulator-radio-message-limit-notice.description: Text shown when the number of radio messages has been capped in the simulator user interface

simulator-radio-no-messages.description: Text shown when there are no radio messages to display in the simulator user interface

simulator-radio-off.description: Text shown when there are no radio messages because the radio is off in the simulator user interface

simulator-radio-send.description: Aria label for the simulator radio send button

simulator-radio-user.description: Visually hidden text for a radio message sent from the user to the simulated micro:bit. Text of the message follows.

simulator-reference-link.description: Aria label for simulator Reference link button

simulator-reset.description: Aria label for the reset simulator button

simulator-serial-terminal.description: Aria label for the simulator serial terminal

simulator-start-simulator.description: Aria label for the large play button on the simulator board

simulator-stop.description: Aria label for the stop simulator button

simulator-touch-logo.description: Name for the touch logo pin on the V2 micro:bit board. Used in the simulator.

simulator-unmute.description: Aria label for the unmute simulator button

software-versions.description: Heading for a table of software versions in the about dialog

terms-of-use.description: Terms of use menu option text

third-party-module-explanation.defaultMessage: This file is a third-party module and is not intended to be edited.
third-party-module-explanation.description: Explanation shown instead of the code editor for third-party modules.

third-party-module-how-to.defaultMessage: Allow editing third-party modules in <link>Settings</link> to modify this module.
third-party-module-how-to.description: Explanation of how to allow editing for third-party modules.

timeout-error-description.defaultMessage: Unable to connect to the micro:bit
timeout-error-description.description: Description for error messages relating to WebUSB timeout

timeout-error-title.description: Title for error messages relating to WebUSB timeout

toolkit-error-loading.defaultMessage: An error occurred loading the toolkit.
toolkit-error-loading.description: Error shown if we failed to load toolkit content

toolkit-view-documentation.description: Aria label for the toolkit topic right arrow

transfer-hex-message-one.defaultMessage: Drag the hex file from your Downloads folder to the MICROBIT drive.
transfer-hex-message-one.description: Text in the transfer hex dialog

transfer-hex-message-two.defaultMessage: You can Open the hex file later to continue editing.
transfer-hex-message-two.description: Text in the transfer hex dialog

transfer-hex-title.defaultMessage: Transfer saved hex file to micro:bit
transfer-hex-title.description: Title for the transfer hex dialog

undo.description: Aria label for the undo button

unexpected-error-description.defaultMessage: Please try again or <link>raise a support request</link>
unexpected-error-description.description: Text shown for unexpected error scenarios

unexpected-error-title.defaultMessage: Please try again or <link>raise a support request</link>
unexpected-error-title.description: Text shown for unexpected error scenarios

user-guide.description: Menu item for link to user guide site

visit-dot-org.defaultMessage: visit microbit.org (opens in a new tab)
visit-dot-org.description: alt text for logo link to .org

webusb-error-clear-connect-description-1.defaultMessage: Another process is connected to this device.

webusb-error-clear-connect-description-2.defaultMessage: Close any other tabs that may be using WebUSB (e.g. MakeCode, Python Editor), or unplug and replug the micro:bit before trying again.

webusb-error-clear-connect-title.defaultMessage: Another page or browser tab is connected to this micro:bit
webusb-error-clear-connect-title.description: Title of error for WebUsb connection

webusb-error-default-title.description: Default title for error messages relating to WebUSB

webusb-error-reconnect-microbit-descript.defaultMessage:
Please follow these steps, then try again:

  • unplug the USB cable
  • unplug the battery pack if one is attached
  • reconnect the USB cable
  • reconnect the battery pack if one was attached

webusb-not-supported.defaultMessage: Unfortunately, WebUSB is not supported in this browser and your program will be saved to your computer instead. Follow the steps on the next screen to transfer it to your micro:bit. We recommend Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.
webusb-not-supported.description: Explantion shown when user's browser doesn't support WebUSB

webusb-not-supported-title.defaultMessage: This browser does not support WebUSB
webusb-not-supported-title.description: Title of dialog shown when user's browser doesn't support WebUSB

webusb-why-use.defaultMessage: With WebUSB you can program your micro:bit and connect to the serial console directly from the online editor.
webusb-why-use.description: Shown to encourage use of browser that supports WebUSB

welcome-message.defaultMessage: Watch our short guide to some of the key features, or get coding right away.

welcome-title.defaultMessage: Welcome to the micro:bit Python Editor

welcome-video-alt.description: iframe title for the welcome video

zoom-in-action.description: Text label for zoom in button

zoom-out-action.description: Text label for zoom out button
